dhp77:1: These verbs appear to be third-person optative, not second-person imperative.
dhp78:3: A _kalyāṇa-mitta_ (lit. “beautiful friend”) is a friend who has good spiritual qualities, and who helps one develop those same good qualities.
dhp87:2: The word _bhāvetha_ is in second person, whereas the word _paṇḍito_ is third person. Usually this would indicate that they do not go together. However, there does not appear to be another way to interpret this sentence; perhaps there is a minor grammatical error in the recorded text.
